Type.Name: UInt32Converter

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UInt32Converter extends System.ComponentModel.BaseNumberConverter

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

remarks.para: This converter can only convert a 32-bit unsigned integer object to and from a string.
The value type represents unsigned integers with values ranging from 0 to 4,294,967,295. This data type is not supported in Visual Basic.

block.para: You should never create an instance of a . Instead, call the method of . For more information, see the examples in the base class and How to: Implement a Type Converter.

summary.para: Provides a type converter to convert 32-bit unsigned integer objects to and from various other representations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.
